thread.title: Brexit Heads for Showdown Over Irish Border

author: Simon Nixon
title: Brexit Heads for Showdown Over Irish Border
text:
The most remarkable thing about Boris Johnson’s speech on Wednesday in which he supposedly set out to reassure pro-Europeans worried about Brexit was what he didn’t say.

Astonishingly, the U.K. foreign secretary had nothing to say about what is arguably Britain’s biggest foreign-policy challenge. Ireland is the only member of the European Union with which the U.K. shares a land border—one of the most unstable in Europe not so long ago. In the last 20 years, and thanks in large part to shared membership of the EU, relations... To Read the Full Story Subscribe Sign In
